page.title: 02A day in the life of Mrs B.
page.content: On a working day everybody helps to make the packed lunches, as well as their own beds. I drive from Whittlesford to work through the country lanes and it's always difficult to park in Cambridge. Sometimes, as an architect, I have to meet builders on building sites to talk about problems, or the work they have to do. In the office I work out colours for the inside of my next project. I have been working on the design of a school for handicapped children. Sometimes I shop at lunch-time, but in summer Cambridge is very crowded with tourists. I leave work earlier than most people in the practice, to meet the children from school. Sometimes we go to the Library or swimming classes. I may cook cakes in the evening, or play tennis.
